snippet: David Bryant, who was convicted in the murder of Karen Smith nearly 40 years ago, was released after a judge found his lawyer had provided a poor defense.
abstract: David Bryant is freed after 40 years in prison when Justice Seth L Marvin of State Supreme Court of New York vacates conviction for rape and murder of 8-year-old Karen Smith in the Bronx in1975; Marvin rules that Bryant's lawyer had failed to present evidence that could have raised a reasonable doubt about his client's guilt; Bryant has long maintained his innocence, saying his confession was coerced.
lead_paragraph: David Bryant, who was convicted in the murder of Karen Smith nearly 40 years ago, was released after a judge found his lawyer had provided a poor defense.

headline.seo: Bronx Judge Vacates Conviction in Girl’s 1975 Killing
headline.main: Blaming Defense, Judge Frees Man Convicted in ’75 Murder
headline.print_headline: Blaming Defense, Judge Frees Man Convicted in ’75 Murder
